query: Computer Science students (undergrad or grad) in USA or Canada for part-time or intern role coding on AI SMS agent project - must have public GitHub repos or portfolio showing completed software projects, demonstrate genuine interest in AI/LLMs through coursework or side projects, willing to work remotely and learn existing codebase, tech stack agnostic but must show ability to ship working code

channels.name: GitHub - LLM Portfolio Students
channels.description: CS students with dedicated LLM/AI portfolio repositories showcasing RAG, chatbots, and multimodal applications

example.name: kimmypracha
example.description: MS CS Student at UCSD working on LLM Evaluation & Reasoning, Human-Centered AI, and CS Education. Currently researching LLM self-evaluation and fine-tuning with RL paradigm. Open to collaboration on fun projects.

channels.reason: High quality candidates with demonstrated LLM expertise and portfolio of completed projects. Students are explicitly interested in collaboration and have shipped working code.

channels.name: LinkedIn - CS Students with AI/ML Internship Experience
channels.description: Computer science students and recent grads with AI/ML internship experience actively seeking opportunities
channels.searchQuery: site:linkedin.com/in computer science student intern AI machine learning projects USA Canada

example.name: Aryan Chandra
example.description: CS + Math @ UT Austin, AI Intern @ Cognitive Space. Building Paralegal.AI with Legal-BERT. 4+ years experience in software dev, ML, and game design. Created cross-platform mobile app with 5,000+ users. GitHub: TheAryanchandra

channels.reason: Active students with proven ability to ship working code at scale. Strong AI/LLM experience and demonstrated interest in building practical applications.

channels.name: LinkedIn - Software Engineering Fellows (HeadStarter AI)
channels.description: CS students participating in AI-focused fellowship programs with strong software engineering fundamentals
channels.searchQuery: site:linkedin.com/in HeadStarter AI SWE Fellow computer science student

example.name: Ivan Valdez
example.description: CS @ UIUC (4th year), SWE Intern @ FEDDATA, SWE Fellow @ HeadStarter AI. Strong interest in AI, Machine Learning, and NLP. Economics minor. Actively building AI/ML projects.

channels.reason: Students in structured AI fellowship programs demonstrate commitment and are actively seeking opportunities. Strong technical fundamentals with AI/ML interest.

channels.name: GitHub - Recent CS AI/ML Graduates
channels.description: Recent CS graduates (2024-2025) with AI/ML specialization and extensive project portfolios
channels.searchQuery: site:github.com AI ML graduate 2025 LLM projects

example.name: myselfshravan
example.description: CSE (AI & ML) Graduate 2025 from M.S. Ramaiah Institute of Technology. 180+ projects shipped. Built RAG applications with ChromaDB, Mistral 7B & Llama 2. Fine-tuned BART models. ML Project Engineer experience. Full-stack AI builder.

channels.reason: Recent graduate with extensive hands-on experience shipping AI projects. Prolific builder with demonstrated ability to work with modern LLM stack. May be available for part-time/contract work.

channels.name: Devpost - AI/LLM Hackathon Participants
channels.description: Students who participated in AI/LLM-focused hackathons at top universities (Cornell, UC Berkeley, etc.)
channels.searchQuery: site:devpost.com LLM hackathon student projects Cornell Berkeley

example.name: LLaMahack Cornell-Tech participants
example.description: 24-hour student hackathon at Cornell-Tech exploring cutting-edge LLMs. Projects include Llabeler (auto data labeling with LLMs), ScriptAI (AI feedback for presentations), and learning tools using few-shot learning.

channels.reason: Students demonstrate ability to rapidly build and ship LLM applications under time constraints. Hackathon participants are typically eager for opportunities and comfortable with fast-paced development.

channels.name: LinkedIn - Canadian CS Students with AI Projects
channels.description: Canadian university CS students with AI/ML projects and internship experience
channels.searchQuery: site:linkedin.com/in computer science student Canada AI machine learning projects Toronto

example.name: Dev Patel
example.description: Greater Toronto Area. Data Analyst Intern @ CIBC Summer 2024. Building StockEye discord bot for automated investment analysis using ML. Implementing ML algorithms for stock prediction. Active in AI/ML student collaborations.

channels.reason: Canadian students meeting geographic requirements with practical AI project experience. Discord bot development shows ability to integrate AI into real applications.

channels.name: Buildspace - Nights & Weekends Program
channels.description: Students building projects (tech and non-tech) over 6-week program with demo days
channels.searchQuery: buildspace nights weekends AI LLM student projects

example.name: Buildspace S4 Demo Day Participants
example.description: 1000+ students showcased projects built over 6 weeks. Many using GPT-3, Stable Diffusion, and LLMs. GenAI B2C applications with focus on prompt engineering. 30,000+ people joined program. Community of builders eager to ship.

channels.reason: Large community of builders with demonstrated ability to ship projects. Many AI-focused projects. Students are self-motivated and comfortable with remote work and rapid iteration.

channels.name: Hacker News - Show HN (Student AI Projects)
channels.description: Students posting their AI/LLM projects on Show HN for community feedback
channels.searchQuery: site:news.ycombinator.com Show HN student AI LLM project GitHub

example.name: Show HN LLM Project Contributors
example.description: Students building AI codebase tutorial generators, Git-to-LLM converters, unified LLM chat apps, and local Perplexity clones. Projects demonstrate deep understanding of LLM architecture and practical applications.

channels.reason: Students posting on HN are typically high-quality builders seeking feedback and opportunities. Projects are production-ready and demonstrate strong technical skills. Community engagement shows willingness to learn.

keyRequirements: Public GitHub repos with completed projects
